questions.Question: Which of the following is a book written by Shashi Tharoor?

questions.Question: George Bernard Shaw, the great dramatist, was -

questions.Question: Which author employed India's obsession for cricket as the theme for his recent book 'selection day'?

questions.Question: Who is the author 'The Association of Small Bombs', which is currently shortlisted for the International Dublin Literary Award?
questions.solution: Solution:		World famous book “The Association of Small Bombs" is written by Indian - American author Karan Mahajan. His first novel was 'Family Planning'. The book was shortlisted for the International Dublin Literary Award. The Association of Small Bombs was a finalist for the National Book Award 2016.

questions.Question: The book 'Kargil : Turning the Tide' is written by -
questions.solution: Solution:		Penned by Lieutenant General Mohinder Puri, the book titled 'Kargil: Turning the Tide' is a first - hand narrative of the operations of 8 Mountain Division, which was tasked to evict the infiltrators from the Drass - Mushkoh Sector during Operation Vijay.

questions.Question: "Man without society is either a beast or a God". Who said this?
questions.solution: Solution:		Aristotle, the great Greek philosopher said that 'man without society is either a beast or a God'. According to him man can not live without a society and he is thus solely dependent on society.

questions.Question: Who amongst the following is the author of the book 'A bend in the River'?
questions.solution: Solution:		A Bend in the River is a 1979 novel by Nobel laureate V. S. Naipaul. The novel, telling the story of Salim, a merchant in post - colonial mid 20th century Africa, is one of Naipaul's best known works and was widely praised. It was shortlisted for the Booker Prize in 1979.

questions.Question: Who is the author of 'A Suitable Boy'?
questions.solution: Solution:		Vikram Seth has written acclaimed books in several genres: verse novel, The Golden Gate; travel book, From Heaven Lake; animal fables, Beastly Tales; epic fiction, A Suitable Boy.

questions.Question: Who among the following has directed the film 'Sardar'?
questions.solution: Solution:		Sardar is a 1994 Indian biographical drama film on Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel, one of India's greatest freedom fighters, directed by Ketan Mehta and written by noted playwright Vijay Tendulkar.

questions.Question: Who is the author of the book 'Naked Triangle'?

questions.Question: Who directed the film 'Little Buddha'?

questions.Question: The controversial documentary 'Hell's Angel' broadcasted by Channel 4 on Independent British Television Station is based on who among the following?
questions.solution: Solution:		'Hell's Angel' is a television documentary programme criticising Mother Teresa which premiered in the UK on Channel 4's Without Walls arts strand on 8 November 1994. It was hosted by Christopher Hitchens, directed by Jenny Morgan, and produced by journalist Tariq Ali.

questions.Question: Who is the author of 'Tom Sawyer'?
questions.solution: Solution:		Mark Twain was an American humorist, novelist, and travel writer. Today he is best remembered as the author of The Adventures of Tom Sawyer (1876) and Adventures of Huckleberry Finn (1885).

questions.Question: Who is the author of the book 'The Future of Freedom'?
questions.solution: Solution:		'The Future of Freedom: Illiberal Democracy at Home and Abroad' is a book by Fareed Zakaria analyzing the variables that allow a liberal democracy to flourish and the pros and cons of the global focus on democracy as the building block of a more stable society rather than liberty.

questions.Question: Mulk Raj Anand is the author of -

questions.Question: Who among the following is the author of the book, "Pakistan Paradox : Instability and Resilience"?
questions.solution: Solution:		'Pakistan Paradox: Instability and Resilience' is written by Christophe Jaffrelot. In the book, he seeks to separate the causes of instability in Pakistan by exploring the contradictions in its foundations.

questions.Question: Who is the author of the book titled 'Numbers Do Lie'?

questions.solution: Solution:		'The World Outside My Window' is written by Ruskin Bond.

questions.Question: The first lady of the Indian screen to had been nominated to the Rajya Sabha is -
questions.solution: Solution:		Nargis Dutt became the first patron of Spastics Society of India in 1970s. Her subsequent work with the organization brought her recognition as a social worker, and later a Rajya Sabha nomination in 1980.

questions.Question: Who said the words, 'I disapprove of what you say, but I will defend to Death your right to say it'?
questions.solution: Solution:		Neutrality principle borrows from a stirring maxim often attributed to Voltaire: “I disapprove of what you say, but I will defend to the death your right to say it.”

questions.Question: The celebrated novel 'The Godfather' was authored by -

questions.solution: Solution:		Vishnu Bhagat is the author of 'Betrayal of the Defence Forces'.

List-II (Authors)

Tamas, his best known novel, won the Sahitya Akademi Award in 1975 and was subsequently adapted into a National Award - winning film by Govind Nihalani.

questions.Question: Author of the book 'The City of Joy' is :

questions.Question:

questions.Question: Who has written 'Panchatantra'?
questions.solution: Solution:		The Panchatantra means five books. It is possibly the oldest surviving collection of Indian fables, having been written around 200 BC by Pandit Vishnu Sharma, a Hindu scholar.

questions.Question: Who authored the book titled 'Jinnah often came to our House', which one the 2016 The Hindu Prize?
questions.solution: Solution:		Kiran Doshi, a retired diplomat and educationist from Gujarat, won The Hindu Prize 2016 for his third major work of fiction, 'Jinnah Often Came to Our House', a book set against the political turmoil of the subcontinent from the early part of the 20th century, ending with the Partition and Independence.

questions.Question: In which year was the 'All India Radio' set up?
questions.solution: Solution:		Lionel Fielden was appointed the first Controller of Broadcasting in August 1935. In the following month Akashvani Mysore, a private radio station was set up. On 8 June 1936, the Indian State Broadcasting Service became All India Radio.

questions.Question: Who directed the film 'Sardar'?

questions.Question: Who said "God helps those who help themselves"?
questions.solution: Solution:		The phrase "God helps those who help themselves" is a popular motto which emphasizes the importance of self-initiative.The phrase originated in ancient Greece, occurring as the moral to one of Aesop's Fables, and later in the great tragedy authors of ancient Greek drama. It has been commonly attributed to Benjamin Franklin, however the modern English wording appears earlier in Algernon Sidney's work.

questions.Question: 'Alice in Wonderland' the famous TV serial is based on a book written by -
questions.solution: Solution:		Alice's Adventures in Wonderland (commonly shortened to Alice in Wonderland) is an 1865 novel by English author Lewis Carroll. It tells of a young girl named Alice, who falls through a rabbit hole into a subterranean fantasy world populated by peculiar, anthropomorphic creatures.

questions.solution: Solution:		The serial 'India's Rajiv' was produced and directed by Simi Garewal.

questions.Question: The original name of 'Mahabharata' is -
questions.solution: Solution:		The Mahabharata in its original version was called Jaya Samhita, and it was written down by Ganesha and narrated by Maharishi Ved Vyasa. The original epic had only 8800 shlokas and was called Jaya. Then it was called Vijaya, then Bharata and finally Mahabharata.

questions.Question: 'Man without society is either a beast or a God'. Who said this?
questions.solution: Solution:		Aristotle, the great Greek philosopher said that 'man without society is either a beast or a God'. According to him man can not live without a society and he is thus solely dependent on society.

questions.Question: Who has written the famous book 'Mankind and Mother Earth'?

questions.Question: 'Maya Memsaab' is a film directed by -

questions.Question: The Sanskrit poet called as the Indian Shakespeare -
questions.solution: Solution:		Kalidasa was acclaimed as 'Indian Shakespeare' who penned his masterpieces of plays, poems, epics, etc in Sanskrit.

questions.Question: 'The Discovery of India' was written in Ahmednagar Fort during imprisonment. Who wrote 'The Discovery of India'?
questions.solution: Solution:		Jawaharlal Nehru wrote the book 'The Discovery of India', during his imprisonment at Ahmednagar fort for participating in the Quit India Movement.

questions.Question: The famous work 'Anandmath' was written by -
questions.solution: Solution:		Anandamath is a Bengali novel, written by Bankim Chandra Chatterjee and published in 1882.

questions.Question: The book entitled 'Playing it my way' is related to which cricketer's life -
questions.solution: Solution:		'Playing It My Way' is the autobiography of former Indian cricketer Sachin Tendulkar. It was launched on 5 November 2014 in Mumbai. The book summarises Tendulkar's early days, his 24 years of international career and aspects of his life that have not been shared publicly.

questions.Question: What is unique about the film 'Adi Shankaracharya'?
questions.optionA: It has won the National Award.
questions.optionB: It is the first Bengal film.
questions.optionC: It is the first Sanskrit film.
questions.solution: Solution:		Adi Shankaracharya is a 1983 Indian film in Sanskrit language directed by G. V. Iyer. The film depicts the life and times of 8th century Hindu philosopher, Adi Shankaracharya, who consolidated the doctrine of Advaita Vedanta (Non - dualism) in Hindu philosophy. It was the first film in India to be made in Sanskrit.

questions.Question: Panchatantra has been written by :
questions.solution: Solution:		The Panchatantra means five books. It is possibly the oldest surviving collection of Indian fables, having been written around 200 BC by Pandit Vishnu Sharma, a Hindu scholar.

questions.Question: The author of the book "Zest for Life" is -
questions.solution: Solution:		‘Zest for Life’ is a famous book by Emile Zola. It was originally published in 1884 as ‘La Joie de vivre.’ It was translated into English by Ernest A. Vizetelly as How Jolly Life Is! in 1888 (reissued in 1901 as The Joy of Life) and by Jean Stewart as Zest for Life in 1955.

questions.Question: The book "Six Machine : I don't Like Cricket .... I Love It" is the autobiography of which cricketer?
questions.solution: Solution:		The book “Six Machine: I Don’t Like Cricket … I Love It” is the autobiography of Chris Gayle, a Jamaican cricketer who plays international cricket for the West Indies. The book chronicles how a shy, skinny kid from a tin - roofed shack in the back streets of Kingston became one of the most well-known stars in the global cricketing arena.

questions.Question: Who is the author of the book 'The Rights of Man'?

questions.Question: Which novel of Salman Rushdie was released in 2017?
questions.solution: Solution:		In The Golden House (2017), Rushdie explored the immigrant experience in the United States through a wealthy Indian family that settles in New York City in the early 21st century.

questions.Question: Who among the following is the author of the book 'A Comparison between Women and Men'?
questions.solution: Solution:		Tarabai Shinde (1850 - 1910) was a feminist activist who protested patriarchy and caste in 19th century India. She is known for her published work, Stripurush Tulana ("A Comparison Between Women and Men"), originally published in Marathi in 1882.

questions.Question: The book 'Midnight's Children' has been written by -

questions.solution: Solution:		'Anything but Khamosh' is the biography of Shatrughan Sinha.

questions.Question: The third Indian Council of Cultural Relations (ICCR) distinguished Indologist Award for the year 2017 was awarded to Japanese Professor -
questions.solution: Solution:		President Ram Nath Kovind on 27 November 2017 conferred the 3rd Indian Council of Cultural Relations (ICCR) distinguished Indologist award to Professor Hiroshi Marui of Japan for his exemplary contribution to Indology.

questions.Question: Who among the following is the author of the book 'Indira Gandhi - A Life in Nature'?
questions.solution: Solution:		Jairam Ramesh is the author of the book 'Indira Gandhi - A Life in Nature'.

questions.Question: Who wrote the book "Old History, New Geography"?
questions.solution: Solution:		'Old History, New Geography : Bifurcating Andhra Pradesh' is written by Jairam Ramesh.

questions.Question: Who is the author of the book 'Kamayani'?
questions.solution: Solution:		Kamayani (1936) is a Hindi epic poem by Jaishankar Prasad.

questions.Question: Who is the writer of "A Brief History of Time"?
questions.solution: Solution:		Stephen Hawking is the writer of "A Brief History of Time".

questions.Question: 'Nature never did betray the heart that loved her' is a quotation from -
questions.solution: Solution:		'Nature never did betray the heart that loved her' is a quotation from William Wordsworth.

questions.Question: Which one of the following books was written by Tilak?
questions.solution: Solution:		Geeta Rahasya was written by Tilak.

questions.Question: Which of the following is not written by Munshi Premchand?
questions.solution: Solution:		'Guide' is written by R. K. Narayan.

questions.Question: 'A Critique of Pure Reason' book was written by
questions.solution: Solution:		'A Critique of Pure Reason' book was written by Immanuel Kant.

questions.Question: The famous character Pickwick was created by -
questions.solution: Solution:		Samuel Pickwick is a fictional character and the main protagonist in The Pickwick Papers (1836), the first novel by author Charles Dickens.

questions.Question: Who among the following is the author of the book 'Nineteen Eighty Four'?
questions.solution: Solution:		Nineteen Eighty four, also published as 1984 is a novel by English author George Orwell published in 1949 as a warning against totalitarianism.

questions.Question: Who wrote 'Lady Chatterley's Lover'?
questions.solution: Solution:		'Lady Chatterley's Lover' is a novel by D. H. Lawrence, published in a limited English - language edition in Florence (1928) and in Paris (1929).

questions.Question: Who wrote the famous line : 'A thing of beauty is a joy forever'?
questions.solution: Solution:		John Keats dedicated this poem to the late poet Thomas Chatterton. The poem begins with the line "A thing of beauty is a joy for ever".

questions.Question: Who wrote 'Jungle Book'?
questions.solution: Solution:		Rudyard Kipling wrote 'Jungle Book'.

questions.Question: The serial 'India's Rajiv' was produced and directed by -
questions.solution: Solution:		The serial 'India's Rajiv' was produced and directed by Simi Garewal.

questions.Question: Who has written the book 'Courtyards of my childhood - A Memoir'?
questions.solution: Solution:		Romola Chatterjee has written the book 'Courtyards of my childhood - A Memoir'.
